header:
There's a new release of DBD::mysql coming.
If you use it, Michiel would appreciate the developer release being tested.

entries.title: NICEPERL's lists
entries.text: Miguel Prz (NICEPERL)'s regular lists: Great modules released last week; MetaCPAN weekly report; StackOverflow Perl report.
entries.author: miguel_prz

entries.title: A new release of DBD::mysql
entries.author: michiel_beijen
entries.text: Michiel announces a new developer release of DBD::mysql, with improved handling of UTF-8, and lots of other improvements. He's looking for more testing, and if that doesn't turn up anything bad, then a non-developer release will come this week.

entries.author: shoichi_kaji
entries.text: Kaji-san explains how you can make your CPAN distributions support static installation. This means a client doesn't have to run Makefile.PL or Build.PL, which makes the installation process much quicker.
entries.title: Make your CPAN module static installable
P5P Mailing List Summary: February 20th-26th
entries.author: sawyer_x
entries.text: Sawyer's weekly update from the P5P mailing list, the headline of which is that Perl 5.25.10 is now available.
Sinan has been grubbing around in Perl's internals, as part of his ongoing quest for something-or-other related to Unicode, Perl, and Windows.
entries.author: sinan_unur
entries.title: For your 'İ's and 'ı's only

entries.author: gabor_szabo
entries.text: Gabor goes through some of the tools you can use to package your code, for CPAN, or not.
entries.title: Tools to package Perl scripts, modules, and applications
Modules - Behind the scenes
entries.text: Gabor has a look at some of the core modules that are shipped with Perl itself.
entries.author: gabor_szabo

entries.title: The IOs Are A-Changin'
entries.text: The regular weekly roundup of Perl 6 news: some bugs have been fixed, some things have been made faster, and some other stuff.
entries.author: liztormato

entries.title: A Unicode Search Tool
entries.author: moritz_lenz
entries.text: Moritz takes us through the creation of a command-line tool for looking up Unicode characters, inspired by the uni command for Perl 5.

entries.title: Telegram Keyboard Button Encoding
entries.author: flavio_poletti
entries.text: Telegram is a messaging service, one of the best-known features of which is end-to-end encryption of your messages. In the client you can define custom buttons, and Flavio has used Perl to abuse this feature.

entries.title: Solving twenty-four puzzles
entries.text: Back in July of last year, Mark blogged about a type of puzzle that his kids were having fun with. Here he talks through the design of his solution, and links to his Perl code.
entries.author: mark_dominus

entries.text: Dimitar announces the first release of Camel Doctor, a web-based interface to the Perl debugger.
entries.author: ddmitov
entries.title: Camel Doctor version 0.1.0

entries.text: Makoto Nozaki, who is the chair of the Perl Foundation grants committee, has joined TPF board as secretary.
entries.author: jim_brandt
entries.title: Makoto Nozaki Appointed Secretary

entries.text: Nolan shares what it can feel like, maintaining open source projects that are popular. TL;DR: "I've already told my partner that, if and when we decide to start having kids, I will probably quit open source for good".
entries.author: nolan_lawson
entries.title: What it feels like to be an open-source maintainer
The fREW Schmidt Interview Experience
entries.author: frew_schmidt
entries.text: Frew shares his thoughts on interviewing developers, based on his experience interviewing candidates for ZipRecruiter. As he says, ultimately interviewing is really hard.

subject: Release of DBD::mysql coming
